Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( u(t, x) = e^{tA}x \\) where \\( A \\) is a complex matrix. We examine the impact of the integral transformation \\( g(t, x) = \\int_0^t e^{sB}x \\, ds \\), where \\( B \\) is another complex matrix, applied at time zero.

If the transformation \\( g(t, x) \\) is introduced at time zero in addition to \\( u(t, x) \\), will the output at \\( T \\) depend solely on the initial vector and matrix \\( A \\)?
Explanation: The introduction of \\( g(t, x) \\) at the initial time imposes an additional transformation through matrix \\( B \\), resulting in an integral impact alongside the exponential effect of matrix \\( A \\). The outcome at time \\( T \\) is thus influenced by both matrices, \\( A \\) and \\( B \\), affecting the evolution of the system in a combined manner.
